description: European leaders are meeting in Brussels on Thursday to reaffirm their commitment to Kyiv, despite discussions on EU enlargement stalling and support for Ukrainian refugees spread out across Europe wavering.

description: Faced with the unpredictable policies of Trump, Japanese leaders are questioning the need to develop an alternative diplomatic and security strategy to reduce their dependence on the US.

headline: China has enlisted star influencers to boost its global image
description: Taiwanese and American influencers recount their travels in the People's Republic on social media, marveling at the comfort of public toilets or the height of skyscrapers. A state-run media outlet even offers an all-expenses-paid trip âˆ’ provided the influencer has more than 300,000 followers.

headline: 'Once upon a time in Gaza': A Palestinian tragicomedy
description: The despairing humor shines through in the latest feature film by brothers Arab and Tarzan Nasser, who won the Best Director award at Cannes in the Un Certain Regard section.

headline: Fariba Adelkhah, anthropologist: 'The Western view of Iranian society is binary and ignores its increasing complexity'
description: Challenging the widespread notion that Iranian society is split between 'good' democrats and 'evil' Islamists, the Franco-Iranian researcher argues that most citizens criticize the regime not for its religious orientation, but for its repression of freedoms.

'How far should one go to accommodate Trump, who makes no secret of his disdain for Europeans?'
description: From flattery to concessions, every detail was arranged to minimize the risk of a diplomatic incident at the NATO summit in The Hague. It is time to change tactics, argues Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

headline: Robert Malley: 'The adversaries of the Islamic Republic of Iran would be wrong to celebrate too much'
description: Israel's recent military offensives in Gaza, the West Bank, Lebanon and, together with the US, in Iran, will fuel hatred of the West and a desire for revenge across the Middle East, writes Robert Malley, the lead negotiator of the 2015 Iranian nuclear deal.

headline: French MPs investigating TikTok: 'Young people are being sacrificed'
description: A parliamentary committee investigating TikTok's psychological effects on minors, launched in March under rapporteur Laure Miller and chair Arthur Delaporte, who spoke to Le Monde, wrapped up its hearings on June 24.
